summary: This is a memorandum from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General documenting an interview with a Federal Bureau of Prisons employee (referred to as BOP EMPLOYEE) regarding the events surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The employee discusses staffing issues, count procedures, and states he was not informed that Epstein needed a new cellmate after his previous cellmate was released.

connections.description: Reyes was Epstein's cellmate in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York prior to his release.
The interviewee is a staff member under the leadership of Captain Darden at MCC New York.
Both are BOP staff members working in the SHU. Grijalva is identified as an SOS who may have had information about inmate Reyes.
The interviewee turned over his shift and relayed information about Epstein's status to Officer Davis.
Both are DOJ OIG Special Agents who conducted the interview of the BOP employee.

events.title: Epstein's Last Full Day Before Death
events.description: The BOP employee worked overtime and his regular shift. Epstein was in the attorney conference room all day and did not return to the SHU. His cellmate, Efrain Reyes, was also absent and had been released.

events.title: Epstein's Initial Suicide Attempt
events.description: The BOP employee learned about Epstein's initial suicide attempt upon returning from military orders in July 2019.

events.title: OIG Interview of BOP Employee
events.description: DOJ OIG agents interviewed a BOP employee regarding the events surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death at MCC New York.

locations: United States Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York, 1 Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York
keyFacts: The interviewed BOP employee stated he was never informed that Jeffrey Epstein required a new cellmate after Efrain Reyes was released, contradicting potential claims from other staff.
The employee described staffing levels at MCC New York as 'abysmal' and stated it was often impossible to perform required 30-minute inmate checks on shower days due to inmate movement and low staff.
The employee admitted that count logs were sometimes filled out after the fact or even without completing the checks, though he claimed he tried not to do this.
On August 9, 2019, Epstein spent the entire day in an attorney conference room and never returned to the SHU during the employee's shift, which ended at 4:00 PM.
The employee was on military orders for approximately half of his three-month rotation in the SHU, including during July 2019 when Epstein's initial suicide attempt occurred.
